description: This state government bill prohibits the use of certain flame-retardant chemicals in certain products.

description: This state government bill appropriates money for the settlement of claims made for losses and injuries suffered by persons incarcerated in a state correctional facility.
title: University of Minnesota (U of M) microbial sciences and research building bond issue and appropriation

description: This state government bill allows families of deceased individuals to raise an objection to an autopsy based on religious beliefs under certain circumstances.
title: Physician assistant program alternate supervising physician provisions modification

description: This state government bill amends the inflation protection for long-term care partnership policies from no less than three percent per year, to no less than one percent per year.
title: Education opportunity income tax credit establishment

description: This state government bill requires health carriers to allow applicants or policy holders to change their agent of record. The bill also requires MNsure to allow a consumer to retroactively appoint a navigator, or agent of record.
title: Youth workforce development competitive grant program appropriation

description: This state government bill requires individuals getting a divorce to get a certificate of dissolution.
title: Health clubs notification of members of criminal incidents involving child members requirement

description: This state government bill requires regional and local emergency medical service programs to develop stroke transport protocols.
title: Minnesota state academies for the deaf capital improvements bond issue and appropriation

description: This state government bill establishes Minnesota’s participation in the interstate medical licensure compact, which enables physicians to practice in states that have adopted the compact.
title: Farmer-lender mediation act sunset date extension

description: This is the Gambling Control Board’s omnibus policy bill.
title: Honey bee habitat program establishment

description: This state government bill allows motorists to provide proof of insurance in an electronic format.
title: Firearms; permit to carry application required to be made to a chief of police of a municipality, and if no chief of police, to a county sheriff.

description: This is the Department of Labor and Industry’s omnibus policy bill.
title: Detoxification services county of financial responsibility human services department reimbursement requirement

description: This state government bill designates a segment of Trunk Highway 149 (Dodd Road) in Mendota Heights as Officer Scott Patrick Memorial Highway.
title: Firearms and ammunition regulations and modifications

description: This state government bill extends equity-stripping protections to farm owners who reside at their farm.
title: Champlin Mill Pond dam grant bond issue and appropriation

description: This state government bill amends the state Strategic Litigation Against Public Participation (SLAPP) government protections. SLAPP provisions provide protections against civil suits for public participation in favorable government action.
title: Electric generation systems pollution control property tax exemption gradual elimination

description: This bill requires Uber and Lyft to carry liability insurance for their drivers during all phases of operation.
title: Richfield on-sale wine and malt liquor licenses issuance authorization

description: This bill ratifies labor agreements for Minnesota State University’s Administrative and Service Faculty, Minnesota State College Faculty, Minnesota Nurses Association, InferFaculty Organization, and the Minnesota Law Enforcement Association.
title: Minnesota association of professional employees (MAPE) retirement coverage under the Minnesota state retirement system (MSRS)

description: This state government bill designates Trunk Highway 36 in Maplewood to be named “Sergeant Joseph Bergeron Memorial Highway.”
title: Northeast higher education district projects bond issue and appropriation

description: This state government bill modifys games, prizes, and other provisions regulating the conduct of lawful gambling and prohibits the director of the State Lottery from offering casino-style games.
title: Dakota county community development agency tax increment financing (TIF) district establishment

description: This is the Omnibus Agriculture Policy Bill.
title: Minneapolis; funding provided to preserve and renovate a facility that provides educational and cultural experiences to students, tourists, and Minnesota residents; bonds issued; and money appropriated.

description: This state government bill will modernize Minnesota’s workers’ compensation system and control health care costs associated with worker injuries.
title: Wolf hunting closed in Indian reservations.

description: This state government bill extends the expiration date of the e-health advisory committee to June 30, 2021. The bill also removes the expiration date for the Trauma Advisory Task Force and Maternal Child Health Advisory Task Force.
title: Southern and southwestern Minnesota initiative foundation collaborative pilot project grant appropriation

description: This state government bill designates the Sunday before Memorial Day as “Military Spouses and Families Day.”
title: Actions for damages based on services or construction to improve real property limitations modified.

description: This state government bill changes “Hire a Veteran Month” from May to July in Minnesota.
title: Corrections; time period a person may be held in jail or state correctional facility limited.

description: This state government bill makes technical changes to the statute that allows corporations to convert Limited Liability Corporations that passed during the last biennium.
title: Criminal surcharge amount and appeal fees amended.

description: This state government bill allows Crow Wing County to make the offices of auditor-treasurer and recorder appointed positions, subject to an 80 percent vote of the county board and reverse referendum.
title: Revenue authorized to offset payments or pupil weight reductions related to student participation in postsecondary enrollment options.

description: This state government bill provides an exemption from licensure requirements for afterschool programs that serve children from kindergarten through grade 12, and are operated by nonprofit organizations. The bill also repeals a moratorium on school-age child care licensing that was passed in 2012 and expires in July 2015.
title: Trade and cultural exchange relationship established between Minnesota and Somalia, funding provided, and money appropriated.

description: This state government bill creates a working group to develop a “Silver Alert” system to provide the public with information on missing persons who are senior citizens suffering from dementia, Alzheimer’s disease, or other impairments.
title: School aid payment percentage reduction legislative majority vote requirement

description: This state government bill repeals outdated language governing how the Department of Corrections transfers juveniles between states.
title: Cook county higher education appropriation

description: This state government bill allows self-storage facilities in Minnesota to sell insurance products to customers who store personal property at the facility.
title: Washington County; Manning Avenue trail crossing funding provided, and money appropriated.

description: This state government bill reduces the minimum number of meetings that the board of the District One Hospital District must hold.
title: Commissioner of education directed to seek federal approval to modify the multiple measurements rating to calculate graduation rates in districts and schools serving eligible students with disabilities ages 18 to 21.

description: This state government bill makes technical changes to plat approval law, and the law governing the modification of a cancellation of a contract for deed. The bill also makes conforming changes to state law to mirror federal default real property in certain situations.
title: Spinal cord injury and traumatic brain injury research grant program and advisory committee established, funding provided, and money appropriated.

description: This bill allows members of the county economic development authority in Houston County to serve staggered, three-year terms.
title: Motorboat muffler cutout and bypass use permitted if the motor is incapable of exceeding established noise limits.

description: This is the omnibus family law bill.
title: Omnibus retirement bill #2

description: This state government bill allows banks and credit unions to hold savings promotion raffles, where a participant who deposits money into a savings account has an opportunity to win prizes.
title: Quarry vehicle permit established.

description: This is the Prenatal Trisomy Diagnosis Awareness Act. This bill requires health care practitioners who perform genetic tests on pregnant women for Patua syndrome, Edwards syndrome, or Downs syndrome, to provide information if the results are positive.
title: Taconite revenue levy reductions adjustments

description: This state government bill allows counties to pursue debts owed by nonresidents in conciliation court.
title: Electronic games definitions modified and other technical, clarifying, and conforming changes made.

description: This state government bill authorizes the chief administrative law judge to contract with a retired workers’ compensation judge, when regularly appointed judges are not available.
title: Unreimbursed special education costs general fund budget priority establishment and appropriation

description: This state government bill authorizes sales of state lands that require legislative approval.
title: Rochester local lodging tax authority modification; Rochester food and beverage tax repeal

description: This state government bill designates Camp Ripley and nearby land as sentinel landscape.
title: Collaborative law process evidence availability limited.

description: This state government bill creates enhanced protections for employees of Minnesota Security Hospital who care for people committed by the court as mentally ill and dangerous.
title: Electronic gambling games provisions modifications

description: This local government bill adds to the definition of “energy conservation measure” in Uniform Municipal Contracting Law.
title: Permitting efficiencies modified and created, Pollution Control Agency modified, rulemaking authorized, funding provided, and money appropriated.

description: This is the Revisor’s bill. The bill corrects erroneous, ambiguous, and obsolete references. The bill also removes redundant, conflicting, and superseded provisions and makes corrections to laws, statutes, and rules.
title: Durable medical equipment medical assistance (MA) basic care services exclusion

description: This state government bill allows a patient to bring an injunction against a non-profit hospital, if the hospital has not provided a plain language summary of their financial assistance policy to the patient.
title: Safe sleep spaces for infants in child care clarification; family child care training and background study requirements modification

description: This state government bill extends the filing date for the Cedar Lake area water and sanitary sewer district to file a copy of a special law, passed in 2014.
title: Agricultural homestead determinations modifications

description: This state government bill provides clarification to licensing requirements for professional licensed engineers.
title: Fergus Falls border city development zone powers authorization and appropriation

description: This is the Uniform Voidable Transactions Act. It updates and modernizes the Fraudulent Transfers Act.
title: Independent school district #318, Grand Rapids; Myles Reif center for the performing arts bond issue and appropriation

description: This bill repeals an outdated statute allowing district courts to appoint the Commissioner of Veterans Affairs as guardian of the estate of a veteran or dependent.
title: Detention and corrections data access requirement for domestic fatality review teams

description: This bill provides access to investigational treatments for certain patients.
title: Public employee retirement durational time limit modification for non public employees retirement association (PERA) members

description: This state government bill clarifies requirements related to the publication of mortgage foreclosure advertisements.
title: Rocori trail construction grant bond issue and appropriation

description: This state government bill clarifies provisions for mortgage foreclosure sales.
title: Fire relief association membership payroll deductions provisions modification

description: This state government bill provides emergency response funding for avian influenza in Minnesota.
title: Transportation Department contracting and payment bond governing provisions amended.

description: This state government bill provides an exception for conservators to post bond on behalf of a protected person.
title: Firearms; persons who possess guns on private property after being ordered to leave the premises equal penalties established.

description: This state government bill provides for the filing of a certificate of approved law by Hennepin County.
title: State agencies required to establish youth internships or apprenticeships, utilization of small businesses encouraged in state procurement, and ethnic and cultural heritage tourism promoted.

description: This is the Omnibus Liquor Bill. This state government bill regulates the sale and distribution of alcoholic beverages in Minnesota.
title: Nonemergency transportation services requests for proposals requirements

description: This state government bill directs the Bureau of Criminal Apprehension to perform background checks at the request of Minnesota’s Tribal Nations.
title: Truth in taxation local government budget hearing requirement; notice for proposed property tax requirement repeal

description: This state government bill makes technical corrections and simplifies statutory language related to land surveying.
title: Duluth; NorShor Theatre improvement and access funding provided, bonds issued, and money appropriated.

description: This state government bill allows ambulance medical directors to authorize staffing levels, and applies to ambulance services based in communities with populations of 2,500 or less. The law allows neighboring ambulance service to be from another state and to provide mutual aid for up to 12 hours per day.
title: Agricultural education community expert sponsorship allowed.

description: This state government bill repeals and updates a previous law relating to trusts in Minnesota.
title: Red Wing Levee road and waterfront improvements bond issue and appropriation

description: This state government bill will enhance child protection measures in Minnesota.
title: Supporting Responsible Homeowners and Stabilizing Neighborhoods Act enacted, and homeowner opportunities provided in regard to underwater mortgage loans and foreclosure relief on residential homestead property.

description: This state government bill provides $15.5 million to maintain basic services across the state.
title: Dan Patch commuter rail line restrictions repeal

description: This state government bill will provide $17.3 million in flood and disaster relief for Minnesotans.
title: Minnesota Insurance Marketplace Act (MNsure)

description: This state government bill will simplify tax filing and provide $20 million in immediate tax savings to more than 200,000 middle-income Minnesotans.
title: Income, franchise, and property tax refund provisions for tax year 2012 conformed to the provisions of the Federal Aviation Administration Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 and the American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012; and provisions changed relating to the Iron Range Resources and Rehabilitation Board.
